definition: Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
to hear/news/well-known/famous/reputation/fame/to smell/to sniff at
surname Wen
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"

sentences.english: Wen Yiduo ever sang highly of Liu's creation.
sentences.chinese: 闻一多曾高度评价过他的诗歌创作。

sentences.english: A great scholar and poet, Wen Yiduo was brave in absorbing all exotic nutrition beneficial to his pursuit of poetic art.
sentences.chinese: 闻一多在诗艺追求中勇于汲纳一切有益的外来营养。

sentences.english: The four directions causes that affect Wen Yiduo's politic chosen has been analysed in this text.
sentences.chinese: 本文分析了影响闻一多政治抉择的四方面原因。

sentences.english: On Dance is one of the essays by Wen Yiduo in his typology of art.
sentences.chinese: 《说舞》是闻一多的艺术类型论系列论文中的一篇。

sentences.english: Can not write to it, put the poem Mr. Wen Yiduo song it adds.
sentences.chinese: 实在写不出来，就把闻一多先生那首诗谱上曲吧。

sentences.english: The poem Miracle of Wenyiduo is a puzzle, difficult to be explained.
sentences.chinese: 闻一多的《奇迹》一诗长期以来是一个难以破解的谜。

sentences.english: His posthumous work was compiled by Zhu Ziqing as The Collection of Wen Yiduo(four volumes).
sentences.chinese: 遗著由朱自清编成《闻一多全集》四卷。

sentences.english: Winter also had become acquainted with a Chinese poet-scholar Wen Yi-to, in the United States for treatment of a lung ailment .
sentences.chinese: 温德还结识了到美国来治肺病的中国诗人学者闻一多。

definition: Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]
Guo Moruo (1892-1978), writer, communist party intellectual and cultural apparatchik
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Yuen Ren Chao (1892-1982), Chinese-American linguist
Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Feng Youlan (1895-1990), distinguished Chinese philosopher
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
Yu Dafu (1896-1945), poet and novelist

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Liang Qichao (1873-1929), influential journalist and a leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Shen Congwen (1902-1988), novelist
Li Gongpu (-1946), communist killed by Guomindang in Kunming in 1946
Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
Xu Zhimo (1897-1931), writer and poet
Zang Kejia (1905-2004), Chinese poet
